head.title: Political Briefing; Going to the Mat In Minnesota Politics

hedline.hl1: Political Briefing; Going to the Mat In Minnesota Politics

abstract.p: Minnesota Gov Jesse Ventura, independent, engages in war of words with Sen Paul Wellstone, liberal Democrat, over Wellstone's interest in running against Ventura for governor instead of seeking re-election to Senate (M)

block.p: Is this something straight from flex-your-pecs Wrestlemania, or what?

In Minnesota, Gov. Jesse Ventura, that old pro grappler, and Senator Paul Wellstone, once himself a pretty good college wrestler, are having at each other in a war of political words that, if they keep at it, will be worthy of a stamp of approval from the World Wrestling Federation.
Is this something straight from flex-your-pecs Wrestlemania, or what?

In Minnesota, Gov. Jesse Ventura, that old pro grappler, and Senator Paul Wellstone, once himself a pretty good college wrestler, are having at each other in a war of political words that, if they keep at it, will be worthy of a stamp of approval from the World Wrestling Federation.
Move over, Triple H, Chyna and The Rock. Both of these guys want to be top gopher. And so come election 2002, the trash-talking stops and they're going to get it on.

Or so they've indicated. The governor, a middle-of-the road political independent, will be up for a second term that year, and the senator, one of the most liberal Democrats in Washington, says he's more inclined to run for governor than go after a third term on Capitol Hill.
''Well,'' the governor told CNBC, ''if the senator wants to get it on, I'm here and waiting.''

What is really driving the senator, the governor went on, is revenge. The senator's son, David, he recalled, worked for one of the also-rans in the 1998 governor's race and, he contended, ''I probably cost the senator's son a job at the capitol.''

''Jesse Ventura made a career out of provoking and intimidating his opponents. Unfortunately, as governor he hasn't been able to leave those tactics behind. One more reason not to take him seriously.''
Not a smash-mouth Smackdown. But don't change that channel.
